sen.e: Sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple: Shogun-san Mountain
sen.cmt: 用語統一しました。:補足しました。

sen.j: 宗派 真言宗豊山派
sen.e: Religious school Shingon sect Buzan school
Religious school Shingon sect Buzan school
Religious school: Shingon sect Buzan school

sen.j: 本尊 愛染明王、阿弥陀如来（共に重要文化財）
sen.e: Honzon (principal object of worship at a temple) Aizen Myoo (Ragaraja), Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata) (Both of them are important cultural properties.)
Honzon (principal object of worship at a temple) Aizen Myoo (Ragaraja), Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata) (Both of them are important cultural properties.)
Honzon (principal image of Buddha): Aizen Myoo (Ragaraja), Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata) (Both of them are important cultural properties.)
sen.cmt: :補足しました。用語統一しました。

sen.j: 創建年 伝・弘仁5年（814年）
sen.e: the year of the foundation in 814 (allegedly)

sen.j: 開基 伝・空海、及雅（開山）
sen.e: Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) allegedly Kukai, 及雅 (kaisan [a founder of temple as the first chief priest])
sen.cmt: 及雅: 読みを確定できませんでした。
sen.e: Kaiki (founding patron) allegedly Kukai, 及雅 (kaisan [a founder of temple as the first chief priest])
Kaiki (founding patron): Allegedly Kukai, 及雅 (kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest))
sen.cmt: :補足しました。記号を修正しました。
This translator seems to be extremely lazy with capitalization…

sen.j: 札所等 長浜六瓢箪めぐり6番
sen.e: fudasho (temples where amulets are collected), etc. The 6th temple of pilgrimage to Nagahama six gourds
sen.cmt: 長浜六瓢箪めぐり6番: 定訳不明
sen.e: Fudasho (temples where amulets are collected), etc. The 6th temple of pilgrimage to Nagahama six gourds

sen.j: 文化財 木造愛染明王坐像、木造阿弥陀如来坐像、絹本着色三月経曼荼羅図（重要文化財）
sen.e: cultural properties wooden seated statue of Aizenmyoo, wooden seated statue of Amidanyorai, Sangatsukyo Mandala-zu with color painting on silk (important cultural properties)
sen.cmt: 絹本着色三月経曼荼羅図: Sangatsukyo Mandala-zu with color painting on silk と訳しました。
sen.e: Cultural properties wooden seated statue of Aizenmyoo, wooden seated statue of Amidanyorai, Sangatsukyo Mandala-zu with color painting on silk (important cultural properties)
Cultural properties: Wooden seated statue of Aizenmyoo, wooden seated statue of Amidanyorai, Sangatsukyo Mandala-zu with color painting on silk (important cultural properties)

sen.j: 舎那院（しゃないん）は滋賀県長浜市にある真言宗豊山派の仏教寺院。
sen.e: Shana-in Temple is a Buddhist temple in Shingon sect Buzan school in Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
Shana-in Temple is a Buddhist temple in Shingon sect Buzan school in Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
Shana-in Temple is a Buddhist temple in Shingon sect Buzan school in Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 芙蓉の名所として知られる。
sen.e: It has been known as a Fuyo-viewing spot.
It has been known as a Fuyo-viewing spot.
It has been known as a Fuyo-viewing spot.

sen.j: 平安時代初期の弘仁5年（814年）、空海（弘法大師）を開基として創建したと伝わる古刹。
sen.e: An ancient temple which has been said that it was founded by Kukai (Kobo Daishi [a posthumous title of the priest Kukai]) in 814, the early Heian Period.
An ancient temple which has been said to have been founded by Kukai (Kobo Daishi [a posthumous title of the priest Kukai]) in 814, the early Heian Period.
An ancient temple which has been said to have been founded by Kukai (Kobo Daishi (a posthumous title of the priest Kukai)) in 814, the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: 用語統一しました。記号を修正しました。

sen.j: 寺号は新放生寺といい、山号の勝軍山は学頭別当職に就いた源義家による中興の時代（11世紀後半）に後三条天皇より賜ったものである。
sen.e: Jigo (the name of a Buddhist temple) is Shinhojyo-ji Temple, and its sango, Shogun-san, was given by Emperor Gosanjo in the era of restoration (the late 11th century) by MINAMOTO no Yoriie who served as Bettoshiki (the office of head administrator) of Gakuto (head student).

Jigo (the name of a Buddhist temple) is Shinhojyo-ji Temple, and its sango, Shogun-san, was given by Emperor Gosanjo in the era of restoration (the late 11th century) by MINAMOTO no Yoriie who served as Bettoshiki (the office of head administrator) of Gakuto (head student).

Jigo (the name of a Buddhist temple) is Shinhojo-ji Temple, and its sango, Shogun-san, was given by Emperor Gosanjo in the era of restoration (the late 11th century) by MINAMOTO no Yoriie who served as Bettoshiki (the office of head administrator) of Gakuto (head student).

sen.j: 16世紀後半の度重なる兵火を受けて堂宇を焼失したが、豊臣秀吉によって再興された。
sen.e: The temple building was burned down in frequent fires caused by war in late 16th century, but it was reconstructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
The temple building was burned down in frequent fires caused by war in the late 16th century, but was reconstructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
The temple building was burned down in frequent fires caused by war in the late 16th century, but was reconstructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 新放生寺は平安時代より長浜八幡宮の学習院であり別当寺を務ていたが、明治時代初期の神仏分離令により子院の一つである舎那院以外は廃された。
sen.e: Since Heian Period, Shinhojyo-ji Temple was the Gakushuin School Corporation of Nagahama Hachimangu Shrine and served as bettoji (a temple attached to a shrine), but one of branch temples, Shana-in Temple, was eliminated due to the Edict of Separation of Shinto and Buddhism.

Since Heian Period, Shinhojyo-ji Temple was the Gakushuin School Corporation of Nagahama Hachimangu Shrine and served as bettoji (a temple attached to a shrine), but the branch temples, Shana-in Temple, was eliminated due to the Edict of Separation of Shinto and Buddhism.

Since Heian period, Shinhojo-ji Temple was the Gakushuin School Corporation of Nagahama Hachimangu Shrine and served as bettoji (a temple attached to a shrine), but the branch temples, Shana-in Temple, was eliminated due to the Edict of Separation of Shinto and Buddhism in early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 用語統一しました。訳漏れ補足しました。

sen.j: 舎那院には廃された寺院の仏像等が集められ、現在に至っている。
sen.e: Buddha statues from eliminated temples were collected in Shana-in Temple, and they are still there now.
Buddha statues from eliminated temples were collected in Shana-in Temple, and they are still there to this day.
Buddha statues from eliminated temples were collected in Shana-in Temple, and they are still there to this day.

sen.j: 現在の住職は吉田龍恵。
sen.e: The current chief priest is Ryukei YOSHIDA.
The current chief priest is Ryukei YOSHIDA.
The current chief priest is Ryukei YOSHIDA.

sen.j: 本堂 - 江戸初期建立
sen.e: Hondo (main hall) - Built in the early Edo period
Hondo (main hall) - Built in the early Edo period
Hondo (main hall) - Built in the early Edo period

sen.j: 護摩堂 - 室町時代建立
sen.e: Goma-do Hall - Built in Muromachi Period
Goma-do Hall - Built in Muromachi Period
Goma-do Hall - Built in Muromachi period
Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon)
Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon)
Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon)

tit.e: old tea room in Shana-in Temple 'Bosen'
Old tea room in Shana-in Temple 'Bosen'
Old tea room in Shana-in Temple 'Bosen'

sen.j: 当寺には小堀遠州作の茶室「忘筌」があったが、大正8年（1919年）、北海道在住の実業家持田勤也が入手し、札幌市へ移築されて「八窓庵」と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: Though the temple had a tea room 'Bosen' built by Enshu KOBORI, a businessman in Hokkaido, Kinya MOCHIDA, obtained it and moved it to Sapporo City, and it became to be called 'Hassoan Tea House.'
Though the temple had a tea room 'Bosen' built by Enshu KOBORI, a businessman in Hokkaido, Kinya MOCHIDA, obtained it and moved it to Sapporo City, and it came to be called 'Hassoan Tea House.'

Though the temple had a tea room 'Bosen' built by Enshu KOBORI, a businessman in Hokkaido, Kinya MOCHIDA, obtained it and moved it to Sapporo City in 1919, and it came to be called 'Hassoan Tea House.'

sen.j: この茶室はその後所有者が変わり、昭和46年（1971年）、札幌市中央区 (札幌市)の中島公園に移築された。
sen.e: The owner of the tea room changed later, and it was moved to Nakajima park in Chuo Ward, Sapporo City (Sapporo City) in 1971.
The owner of the tea room changed, and was moved to Nakajima park in Chuo Ward, Sapporo City (Sapporo City) in 1971.
The owner of the tea room changed, and was moved to Nakajima park in Chuo Ward, Sapporo City (Sapporo City) in 1971.

sen.j: 「八窓庵（旧舎那院忘筌）」の名で昭和11年（1936年）に国の重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: It was designated as the national important cultural property under the name of 'Hassoan Tea House (old Shana-in Temple Bosen)' in 1936.
It was designated as a national important cultural property under the name of 'Hassoan Tea House (old Shana-in Temple Bosen)' in 1936.
It was designated as a national important cultural property under the name of 'Hassoan Tea House (old Shana-in Temple Bosen)' in 1936.

sen.cmt: 文頭のハイフンを削除しました。用語統一しました。

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉の奉献と伝わる。
sen.e: It's been said that it was hoken (offertory) from Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
It's been said that it was a hoken (offertory) from Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
It's been said that it was a hoken (offertory) from Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
